Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 30th overall pick, by Philadelphia in 1965...
Traded from Philadelphia to Los Angeles (N) on 4/1/1965 (Going to LAN: CF A. Phillips, P W. Granger, P P. Edmondson, P J. James. Going to PHI: P S. Koufax, P P. Richert, SS M. Wills)...
Injured on 5/8/1965 with a Stiff Shoulder, out for 6 days...
Injured on 4/13/1966 with a Pulled Bicep Muscle, out for 3 weeks...
Had first career hit on 8/10/1966, off Chris Short (PHI)...
Earned first career win on 8/10/1966...
Injured on 5/22/1968 with a Ruptured Elbow Ligament, out for 4 weeks...
Hit first career homerun on 5/16/1969, off Greg Garrett (PIT)...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/15/1969, winning 2 games with a 0.00 ERA...
Injured on 9/29/1969 with a Inflamed Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Won World Series with Los Angeles in 1971...
Traded from Los Angeles to Houston on 7/31/1975 (Going to LA: 3B C. Speier, P B. Caudill. Going to HOU: P P. Edmondson)...
Won Pitcher of the Month award on 5/1/1976, going 6-0, 0.73...
Was selected to the 1976 Allstar game...
Pitched NO-HITTER against Chicago (N) on 7/16/1976, striking out 2...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/15/1976, winning 2 games with a 2.16 ERA...
Won Cy Young Award in 1976, going 29-7, 1.62 ERA...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/2/1977, winning 2 games with a 1.06 ERA...
Was selected to the 1977 Allstar game...
Signed as a free agent by Atlanta on 2/4/1978 to a 2-year deal worth $7,150,000 per year...
